intro: Gynoxys capituliparva, commonly known as the small-headed gynoxys, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural studies.
